page.title: 09FARMING,ACCESS TO CNEWR LAND
page.content: Although the land belonging to Cnewr Estates Ltd. extends over the water- shed and the escarpment of the Brecon Beacons including the two summits FAN NEDD and FAN GIHIRYCH it is never -theless enclosed farm land and not open to the public for walking. An agreement made in 1980 allows for public access by means of a path which traverses the high land, taking in these summits. Access to the land is still prohibited during the lambing season (15th April to 10th May) and in times of prolonged dry weather. This prohibition results from a disastrous moorland fire during the prolonged drought of 1976 when the peat soil of the land to the south of Fan Gihirych was entirely stripped away by fire. The fire had, in fact, been started by lightning.
